answerText: heterozygous [accept word forms][10] Heterozygosity occurs in an individual when both of these are different for a gene. These represent different copies of the same gene and may produce different phenotypes.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Editors 3 | 3 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The increasing tendency towards this trait in subdivided populations is called the Wahlund effect. For 10 points each: [10] Name this trait which may confer benefits, as in the case of mutations for cystic fibrosis and sickle cell anemia.
